Pre-Game Insights: Cyprus rounded off a dismal qualifying campaign by losing 3-1 to Spain late last week
Lithuania fared much better in their qualifying campaign and have already guaranteed they will not finish bottom in their respective five-team group
Others: Neither side were close to threatening the top two positions in their respective groups
Cyprus and Lithuania meet in Limassol for a friendly on Sunday after both sides completed their Euro 2024 qualifying campaigns on Thursday
Cyprus were ruthless early on and rushed into a 3-0 lead before the half-hour mark, putting the game beyond reach for Cyprus
One positive was that they at least managed to break a goalscoring duck, after going four games without a goal where they also conceded 17 goals
Lithuania also threatened the big boys in the group, giving eventual-qualifiers Hungary a huge scare in Kaunas last month when they led 2-0, but were pegged back late on for a draw
Despite a 2-0 loss in Podgorica against Montenegro, Edgaras Jankauskas's side will finish above Bulgaria due to their superior head-to-head record
Team News: Ketsbaia may tinker and experiment with his Cyprus team here, but his status in the national setup may be in jeopardy after an awful campaign
Lithuania will be without Eligijus Jankauskas, who was a late pull-out prior to the Montenegro game with injury
Paulius Golubickas also missed out on the squad entirely with injury, joining Artemijus Tutyskinas, who is a longer-term absentee
